body:
You actually can do this today, because:

- Server time is available as [`normandy.request_time`](http://normandy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user/filter_expressions.html#normandy.request_time) in filter expressions.
- You can convert a string to a date using the [`date`](http://normandy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user/filter_expressions.html#date) transform.
- Subtracting one date from another in JS returns an integer with the number of milliseconds different between the two dates.

So something like this would work:

```js
// Match users who's creationDate is less than 24 hours
((normandy.telemetry.creationDate|date - normandy.request_time) / (1000 * 60 * 60)) < 24
```

The main problem with this: `creationDate` in the main telemetry packet is not the date the profile was created, it's the date the ping itself was created. I believe you're looking for `environment.profile.creationDate`, which is not a date string, but instead is [the number of days since the profile was created](http://gecko.readthedocs.io/en/latest/toolkit/components/telemetry/telemetry/data/environment.html).

So if days is okay for your comparison, you can use:

```js
// Match profiles that are 14 days or older. Returns false if the ping isn't present.
normandy.telemetry.main.environment.profile.creationDate >= 14
```
